doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: circa 1799; alteration: circa 1867; alteration: 1882; alteration: 1898; alteration: early 20th century; alteration: 1975

Castle Cabin--Called Highland until circa 1840--North Blenheim--Porch Room like Temple Hill, High Meadows, Findowrie, & Wakefield--James Monroe ownership 1793-1826--Goodwin, Buckner, Garrett, Pretlow and Bowen ownership 1826-1867--Rev John E Massey ownership 1867-1930--Jay Winston Johns ownership 1930-1974 & opened to public 1930--College of William and Mary ownership since 1975--Monroe had c 3,000 books in house--Opened to the public 1931

Frame I-House + 1 Story Frame, Paired Column Portico, 9/9, 4/4, 3 Course American Bond, 5 Course American Bond, Wall of Troy Moldings, Beaded Siding, Mortise & Tenon Joinery, Box Cornice, Pitsaw Marks, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Circular Saw Marks, Brick Nogging, Cut Nails with Stamped Heads, Wood Shingles, Triple Hung Sash, 2 Leaf Door, Porch Room, Flue Vaulted Passage, Interesting Mantel, Patera, Colonnettes, Slave Quarters, Pyramidal Outbuilding, Smokehouse, Saw and Grist Mill, Recessed Gardens, Ghost
Milton Grigg, Architect 20th century--Don Swofford, Architect 20th century--Douglas Gilpin, Architect 20th century--Paul Buchanan, Architect 20th century
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Studies in Vernacular Architecture --Virginia Road Traces%Mutual Assurance Society Insurance Policy
Ash Lawn¶still image¶1796/1975¶Grigg, Milton L. (Milton LaTour), 1905-1982
